@CallbackWomen

Code women who are tech speakers.

Programming conferences, shout out with Call for Proposals when you're looking for code women to callback to it.

Tweet programming conference CFPs to @CallbackWomen

"Who do you suggest we reach out to?"

Programming conferences, here are some good starting points for you:

Groups for Women Who Are Programmers

DevChix

@devchix | 1,200+ members. Posts CFPs, outreach messages from conference organizers. Provides ongoing speaker mentorship, abstract writing assistance, and other resources. Submit CFP and additional information for mailing list members, to info@devchix.com. A letter is good.

Women Who Code

@womenwhocode | website | 5,400+ members in USA, Israel, Ireland, India, Mexico

PyLadies

Provides ongoing training, mentorships, practice sessions, and workshops on abstract writing. Contact www.pyladies.com, @PyLadies, and chapters. e.g. @PyLadiesSF

Chix Who Speak

LinuxChix

Women in IT - Speakers and Conference Presenters

doc | 100+ speakers & conference presenters. Many from Europe. Twitter hashtag #ITWomen

Technical Women Speak Too

blog | Announces CFPs

Systers

@systers_org |

website|

list maintainer | 3000+ members

CallbackWomen

@callbackwomen | Code women who are tech speakers. Programming conferences, shout out with your CFP (Call for Proposals) when you’re looking for code women to callback to it.

BridgeFoundry

@bridgefoundry | The non-profit parent organization of RailsBridge. Creates and/or supports broad base of organizations whose mission is diversity in tech.

Women Who Are Speakers & IT Professionals

Speak Up

Speak Up! |

Based at python.org, but is enthusiastically language/community agnostic. Connects speakers, mentors, and conference organizers. Welcomes all genders.

Tech Women Conferences

Grace Hopper Celebration

Annual conference of more than 4000 programmers who are women. Hundreds of speakers overall. Check out previous years’ abstracts, videos, etc.

She’s Geeky

website | Unconference of geek women from a diverse array of technological fields, and women doing technology within non-technical fields.

Write. Speak. Code.

@WriteSpeakCode |

email Professional development conference for women developers by women developers. Empowering ourselves and each other to become thought leaders, conference speakers, & open source contributors.

Twitter Lists

Estelle Weyl’s

RailsBridge’s

Carina C. Zona’s

Jennifer Arguello’s

Directories of Tech Speakers Who Are Women

(not necessarily programming)

GeekFeminism list of women who have been tech conference keynote speakers

DevChix Speakers

Articulate Network > Technology Category

Articulate Network > Mobile Category

Resources

  • Reach out to code women

Tweet @callbackwomen with CFPs of professional software engineers' conferences. We also love to hear about:

  • code of conduct policy
  • proposal-writing mentorship
  • assistance for first-time speakers
  • travel funding for speakers
  • diversity scholarships
  • handicapped accessibility
  • childcare and/or nursing facilities
CallbackWomen is by Carina C. Zona @cczona
